definition: to know sth fluently/well-versed
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]
to be versed in/to know well

sentences.english: Plagueis, the wise, was an adept of some of the most arcane and unnatural applications of the Force.
sentences.chinese: 智者普雷格斯熟谙一些最神秘最反常的原力应用。

sentences.english: Her familiarity with Japanese surprised me.
sentences.chinese: 她对日语的熟谙使我惊奇。

sentences.english: Madame Chiang Kai-shek was a diplomat par excellence. But she was not familiar with Japanese history.
sentences.chinese: 蒋宋美龄是位杰出的外交家，只是对日本史不够熟谙。

definition: to be proficient in
proficient (in sth)/to understand sth through and through
to understand profoundly/well-versed/skillful/practiced/to have the knack
quite familiar with sth
skillful in/proficient in/adept at
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
such matters/things like this/this line of work/this pursuit/this hobby/this endeavor
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
conversant/skilled/proficient
to know well/to be fully aware of
to research carefully/to study intensively
to clearly understand
